title: Pluto: The Indians owe some of their greatest years to Hank Peters
teaser: Some of the Cleveland Indians best years were orchestrated by a man whose name few fans recognize. Hank Peters revived the franchise as president of the ballclub from 1987 to 1991. He died over the weekend at the age of 90. WKSU commentator Terry Pluto first met Peters in Baltimore in 1979. WKSU's Amanda Rabinowitz reports.
